resources.string: This optimization can be disabled by the regex flag `Raw Number`.
When enabled, the rule only applies when both number and content match.

- Reject:
  Same as pressing the decline button. It works completely silently, lockscreen won\'t be turned on, it\'s the recommended type for those who don\'t use voicemail.

- Silence:
  It will ring silently in the background, giving the impression to the caller that you are just busy and have not answered it.

- Answer and Hang Up:
  To avoid being sent to the voicemail. The lockscreen can be turned on for a short while, you might also hear a call end tone(some phones offer an option to mute this sound).

Dialed numbers will be permitted.

Sending message also counts, this only works when READ_SMS permission is granted.

The default setting 3 Days means if a number has been made outgoing calls or sent messages within the past 3 days, calls from that number will be allowed, even if this number is not in contacts.

Only applies for calls, not for text messages.

Priority: 10

Any incoming call will pass if any app in the list has been used recently.

A typical use case:
  You just ordered a pizza in PizzaApp, soon they call you to refund because they are closing. That call would pass if PizzaApp is enabled here.

The default setting 5 Min means any call will be permitted if any of these apps has been used within 5 minutes, by `used` it means either being activated, deactivated, minimized, or killed.

Only applies for calls, not for text messages.

Priority: 10
